intro: Cineraria alliarifolia, commonly known as the silver cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its silvery, woolly leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. The foliage and flowers are often used in garden displays due to their striking appearance.
